message.content: This question requires knowledge about different types of environments and their characteristics. The option (B) sandy zone is the correct answer because sandy zones, such as deserts, typically have low rainfall. The option (A) tropics is incorrect because tropical regions generally have high rainfall. The option (C) sandbox is incorrect because it is not a natural environment and does not have rainfall. The option (D) forests is incorrect because forests usually have moderate to high rainfall, depending on the specific type of forest.

This question requires some basic knowledge about different environments and their characteristics. A sandy zone is an environment that typically has low rainfall because the sandy soil does not retain water well and is not conducive to supporting plant growth. Option (A) is incorrect because the tropics typically have high rainfall. Option (C) is incorrect because a sandbox is not considered a natural environment. Option (D) is also incorrect because forests can have varying amounts of rainfall depending on their location.
